summary.span: 表示一個時間點，通常以一天的日期和時間表示 (相對於國際標準時間)。

span.span: Represents a point in time, typically expressed as a date and time of day, relative to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 結構包含值，連同屬性，定義目前差異執行個體的日期和時間和 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)。The structure includes a value, together with an property that defines the difference between the current instance's date and time and Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 它只會定義日期和時間相對於 UTC，因為結構不包含`Kind`成員，做為結構沒有。Because it exactly defines a date and time relative to UTC, the structure does not include a `Kind` member, as the structure does. 它代表下午 11:59:59，年 12 月 31 到西元 9999年日的日期和時間的 UTC 範圍 12:00:00，年 1 月 1 日午夜 0001 P.m （中古時代） 的值It represents dates and times with values whose UTC ranges from 12:00:00 midnight, January 1, 0001 Anno Domini (Common Era), to 11:59:59 P.M., December 31, 9999 A.D. (C.E.)。(C.E.). [!INCLUDE[japanese-era-note](~/includes/calendar-era.md)] 時間元件的100 奈秒為單位，稱為次滴答聲，則會測量值，且在特定日期的刻度數午夜 12:00，年 1 月 1，西元 0001年The time component of a value is measured in 100-nanosecond units called ticks, and a particular date is the number of ticks since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 0001 A.D. (C.E.)在 行事曆。(C.E.) in the calendar. A值一律表示在內容明確或預設的行事曆。A value is always expressed in the context of an explicit or default calendar. 為能歸因於 leap 秒為單位的刻度未被納入的滴答總數。Ticks that are attributable to leap seconds are not included in the total number of ticks. 雖然值都含有一個位移，它不是完全時區感知的資料結構。Although a value includes an offset, it is not a fully time zone-aware data structure. 其中一個特性時區與 UTC 的時差時，它不會明確地識別時區。While an offset from UTC is one characteristic of a time zone, it does not unambiguously identify a time zone. 執行多個時區會共用相同的 UTC 位移，不僅對單一時區位移變更如果觀察到日光節約時間。Not only do multiple time zones share the same offset from UTC, but the offset of a single time zone changes if it observes daylight saving time. 這表示，只要值會從其時區解除關聯，它可以不再清楚明確地連結回到其原始的時區。This means that, as soon as a value is disassociated from its time zone, it can no longer be unambiguously linked back to its original time zone. 因為是一種結構，已宣告但未初始化的物件包含每個成員欄位的預設值。Because is a structure, a object that has been declared but not otherwise initialized contains the default values for each of its member fields. 這表示，其屬性設定為及其屬性設定為。This means that its property is set to and its property is set to . 您可以建立新藉由呼叫其建構函式，類似於的多載建構函式的多任何的載值結構。You can create a new value by calling any of the overloads of its constructor, which are similar to the overloaded constructors for the structure. 您也可以建立新值指派給值。You can also create a new value by assigning it a value. 這是隱含的轉換;它不需要轉型運算子 （在 C# 中)，或呼叫轉換方法 （在 Visual Basic)。This is an implicit conversion; it does not require a casting operator (in C#) or call to a conversion method (in Visual Basic). 您也可以初始化值的字串表示的日期和時間，藉由呼叫靜態字串剖析方法，其包括許多， ， ，和。You can also initialize a value from the string representation of a date and time by calling a number of static string parsing methods, which include , , , and . 成員結構提供下列方面的功能：The members of the structure provide functionality in the following areas: - 日期和時間運算。Date and time arithmetic. 您可以加入或減去日期或時間間隔，從特定值。You can add or subtract either dates or time intervals from a particular value. 使用算術運算值，不同於具有值，調整時間位移的差異時傳回的結果。Arithmetic operations with values, unlike those with values, adjust for differences in time offsets when returning a result. 例如，下列程式碼會使用減去目前的當地時間，從目前的 UTC 時間的變數。For example, the following code uses variables to subtract the current local time from the current UTC time. 程式碼接著會使用變數，以執行相同的作業。The code then uses variables to perform the same operation. 使用減法值與 UTC，傳回本地時區的差異，同時使用減法值傳回。The subtraction with values returns the local time zone's difference from UTC, while the subtraction with values returns . [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.Type#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Type/cs/Type.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.Type#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Type/vb/Type.vb#1)] - 類型的轉換作業。Type conversion operations. 您可以將轉換值來值，反之亦然。You can convert values to values and vice versa. - 時間的操作和擷取作業。Time manipulation and extraction operations. 您可以擷取日期或時間值。You can extract either the date or the time of a value. 您也可以擷取的特定值元件，例如它的年份或其月份。You can also retrieve the value of a particular component, such as its year or its month. > [!NOTE] > 如果您正在使用刻度值，您想要轉換成某些其他時間間隔，例如分鐘或秒，您應該使用， ， ， ，或常數，以執行轉換。If you are working with a ticks value that you want to convert to some other time interval, such as minutes or seconds, you should use the , , , , or constant to perform the conversion. 例如，若要新增的秒數表示所指定的刻度數元件的值，您可以使用運算式`dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`。For example, to add the number of seconds represented by a specified number of ticks to the component of a value, you can use the expression `dateValue.Second + nTicks/Timespan.TicksPerSecond`. - 日期和時間轉換。Date and time conversion. 您可以將任何轉換到另一個值值，代表另一個時區的時間相同的點。You can convert any value to another value that represents the same point in time in another time zone. 不過，只是套用時區調整規則方法，它會將轉換「 本機系統 」 區域中的日期和時間值。However, a time zone's adjustment rules are applied only in the case of the method, which converts a value to the date and time in the local system zone. - 日期和時間的比較。Date and time comparison. 您可以判斷是否有任何特定值是早於、 同於或晚於另一個值。You can determine whether any particular value is earlier than, the same as, or later than another value. 執行比較之前，所有的值會轉換為 UTC。Before the comparison is performed, all values are converted to UTC.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以使用方法來加入單一作業中的一種以上的時間間隔 （天、 小時、 分鐘、 秒或毫秒為單位）。You can use the method to add more than one kind of time interval (days, hours, minutes, seconds, or milliseconds) in a single operation. 這個方法的行為等同於加法運算子。This method's behavior is identical to the addition operator. 結構也支援特殊的新增方法 (例如， ，和) 的每個時間間隔。The structure also supports specialized addition methods (such as , , and ) for each time interval. > [!NOTE] > 這個方法會傳回新物件。This method returns a new object. 它不會修改目前物件的值加上`timeSpan`其日期和時間。It does not modify the value of the current object by adding `timeSpan` to its date and time. 方法不會影響目前的值物件的屬性。The method does not affect the value of the current object's property. 因為物件不代表特定的時區，時間與日期方法不會考慮特定時區的調整規則執行的日期和時間算術時。Because a object does not represent the date and time in a specific time zone, the method does not consider a particular time zone's adjustment rules when it performs date and time arithmetic. 如果`timeSpan`參數是`null`，這個方法會傳回原始項目的值保持不變的物件。If the `timeSpan` parameter is `null`, this method returns the value of the original object unchanged. ## Examples 下列範例會建立陣列表示目的地之間的班機時間的物件。The following example creates an array of objects that represent the flight times between destinations. 方法接著會將這些時間以代表班機的起飛初始時間的物件。The method then adds these times to a object that represents a flight's initial takeoff time. 結果會反映已排程的抵達時間，在每個目的地。The result reflects the scheduled arrival time at each destination. remarks.format: ## Remarks 小數點後的部分`days`參數是一天的分數部分。The fractional part of the `days` parameter is the fractional part of a day. 比方說，4.5 就相當於 4 天、 12 小時，0 分 0 秒，0 毫秒。For example, 4.5 is equivalent to 4 days, 12 hours, 0 minutes, 0 seconds, 0 milliseconds. `days`參數四捨五入至最接近的毫秒數。The `days` parameter is rounded to the nearest millisecond. > [!NOTE] > 這個方法會傳回新物件。This method returns a new object. 它不會修改目前物件的值加上`days`其日期和時間。It does not modify the value of the current object by adding `days` to its date and time. 因為物件不代表特定的時區，時間與日期方法不會考慮特定時區的調整規則執行的日期和時間算術時。Because a object does not represent the date and time in a specific time zone, the method does not consider a particular time zone's adjustment rules when it performs date and time arithmetic. 將小於一天的時間間隔轉換成一小部分可能遺失有效位數。Converting time intervals of less than a day to a fraction can involve a loss of precision. 如果這是有問題，您可以使用方法，它可讓您在單一方法呼叫中指定的時間間隔的多個類型，並讓您不需要將時間間隔轉換為一天的小數部分。If this is problematic, you can use the method, which enables you to specify more than one kind of time interval in a single method call and eliminates the need to convert time intervals to fractional parts of a day. ## Examples 下列範例會使用列出日期落在星期一、 一週開始日工作，在 2008 年 3 月中的方法。The following example uses the method to list the dates that fall on Monday, the start of the work week, in March 2008. If this is problematic, you can use the method, which enables you to specify more than one kind of time interval in a single method call and eliminates the need to convert time intervals to fractional parts of an hour. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法來列出工作的開始時間移位特定週有每日的兩個八小時值班辦事處。The following example uses the method to list the start times of work shifts for a particular week at an office that has two eight-hour shifts per day. remarks.format: ## Remarks Windows 檔案時間會表示 12:00，年 1 月 1 西元 1601年日午夜起已經過的 100 奈秒間隔數的 64 位元值A Windows file time is a 64-bit value that represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00 midnight, January 1, 1601 A.D. (C.E.)國際標準時間 (UTC)。(C.E.) Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Windows 會使用檔案的時間，來記錄應用程式建立、 存取，或寫入檔案時。Windows uses a file time to record when an application creates, accesses, or writes to a file. 藉由呼叫是透過 Windows API 直接存取 Windows 檔案時間`GetFileTime`函式，它會傳回`FILETIME`結構。A Windows file time is directly accessible through the Windows API by calling the `GetFileTime` function, which returns a `FILETIME` structure. 單一函式參數是要擷取其檔案的時間資訊的檔案控制代碼。The single function parameter is the handle of the file whose file time information is to be retrieved. 檔案控制代碼會擷取藉由呼叫`CreateFile`函式。The file handle is retrieved by calling the `CreateFile` function. `FILETIME`結構的`dwHighDateTime`成員會包含四個高序位位元組的檔案的時間，並將其`dwLowDateTime`成員包含四個低序位位元組。The `FILETIME` structure's `dwHighDateTime` member contains the four high-order bytes of the file time, and its `dwLowDateTime` member contains the four low-order bytes. 接下來的範例說明如何擷取 Windows 檔案時間值，並將它們轉換成值。The example that follows illustrates how to retrieve Windows file time values and convert them to values. Windows 檔案時間值也可以建立從藉由呼叫的值並方法，以及從值，藉由呼叫方法。Windows file time values can also be created from values by calling the and methods, and from values by calling the method. ## Examples 下列範例會使用 Windows API 來擷取 WordPad 可執行檔的 Windows 檔案時間。The following example uses the Windows API to retrieve the Windows file times for the WordPad executable. span.span: Gets a value that represents the local date and time of the current object.

span.span: The local date and time of the current object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果有必要，請屬性會將目前物件的日期和時間為本機系統的日期和時間。If necessary, the property converts the current object's date and time to the local system's date and time. 轉換是兩個步驟的作業：The conversion is a two-step operation: 1. 屬性會將目前物件的時間為 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)。The property converts the current object's time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 2. 然後，此屬性會將 UTC 轉換為當地時間。The property then converts UTC to local time. 有任何無效的時間，模稜兩可的時間對應至當地時區的標準時間。There are no invalid times and ambiguous times are mapped to the local zone's standard time. (不過，轉換可以在其中建立異常： 如果模稜兩可的日期和時間，值可以轉換為 UTC，然後再設回原始的時間與當地時間，會反映出衍生自本機電腦的值。)執行這項轉換時，該屬性適用於任何在當地時區的調整規則。(However, the conversion can create an anomaly: if a value that is derived from the local computer reflects an ambiguous date and time, that value can be converted to UTC and then back to a local time that differs from the original time.) The property applies any adjustment rules in the local time zone when it performs this conversion. 這個屬性會傳回日期和時間元件物件，使用於到轉換。This property returns both the date and the time component of a object, which makes it useful for to conversion. 除了執行任何所需的時間轉換，這個屬性會不同於屬性所設定的值屬性傳回的物件。In addition to performing any necessary time conversion, this property differs from the property by setting the value of the property of the returned object to . ## Examples 下列範例將說明數個轉換的美國地區的當地時間的值太平洋標準時區。The following example illustrates several conversions of values to local times in the U.S. Pacific Standard Time zone. 請注意，最後三次所有模稜兩可;此屬性可讓所有人都對應到單一的日期和時間為太平洋標準時間時區。Note that the last three times are all ambiguous; the property maps all of them to a single date and time in the Pacific Standard Time zone. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個常數的值是 9999 年 12/31/11:59:59 PM + 00:00。The value of this constant is 12/31/9999 11:59:59 PM +00:00. 屬性用來判斷是否新的值物件或算術作業所傳回的值相當於還是早於此最大範圍值。The property is used to determine whether the value of a new object or the value returned by an arithmetic operation is the same as or earlier than this maximum range value. 如果不存在，方法會擲回。If it is not, the method throws an . 任何值會轉換為 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)，這個方法會比較它與之前。Any value is converted to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) before the method compares it with . 這表示值的日期和時間會接近最大的範圍，但其位移是負數，可能會擲回例外狀況。This means that a value whose date and time are close to the maximum range, but whose offset is negative, may throw an exception. 例如，值 12/31/9999 11:00 PM-02:00 je mimo rozsah，因為它是一小時晚於時則會轉換成 UTC。For example, the value 12/31/9999 11:00 PM -02:00 is out of range because it is one hour later than when it is converted to UTC. 有些月曆，這類，支援早於上方的日期範圍。Some calendars, such as the , support an upper date range that is earlier than . 在這些情況下，嘗試存取變數指派或格式化和剖析作業可能會擲回。In these cases, trying to access in variable assignments or formatting and parsing operations can throw an . 而不是擷取的值，您可以擷取從指定的文化特性最有效的日期值的屬性。Instead of retrieving the value of , you can retrieve the value of the specified culture's latest valid date value from the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法可讓編譯器將會自動轉換物件到而不需要明確轉型運算子 （在 C# 中) 或 （在 Visual Basic) 的轉換函式呼叫的物件。The method enables the compiler to automatically convert a object to a object without an explicit casting operator (in C#) or a call to a conversion function (in Visual Basic). 它會定義擴展轉換，不涉及資料遺失，並不會擲回。It defines a widening conversion that does not involve data loss and does not throw an . 方法會進行下列可能如下的程式碼：The method makes code such as the following possible: [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.Operators#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Operators/cs/Operators.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.Operators#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.Operators/vb/Operators.vb#7)] 這個方法相當於建構函式。This method is equivalent to the constructor. 產生的位移物件的值而定屬性`dateTime`參數：The offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the property of the `dateTime` parameter: - 如果值屬性是，日期和時間物件設為等於`dateTime`，並將其屬性設為等於 0。If the value of the property is , the date and time of the object is set equal to `dateTime`, and its property is set equal to 0. - 如果值屬性是或，日期和時間物件設定為等於`dateTime`，並將其屬性設為等於本機系統的目前設定的時區位移。If the value of the property is or , the date and time of the object is set equal to `dateTime`, and its property is set equal to the offset of the local system's current time zone. 這個運算子的對等方法是 The equivalent method for this operator is

remarks.format: ## Remarks 剖析具有三個項目可以按照任何順序出現，且以泛空白字元分隔的字串。 parses a string with three elements that can appear in any order and are delimited by white space. 這三個元素是下表所示。These three elements are as shown in the following table. |項目Element|範例Example| |-------------|-------------| |\<日期 >\|"2/10/2007""2/10/2007"| |\<時間 >\|「 下午 1:02:03""1:02:03 PM"| |\\|"-7:30""-7:30"| 這些項目都是選擇性的雖然\<位移 > 不能單獨出現。Although each of these elements is optional, \ cannot appear by itself. 它必須提供一起\<日期 > 或\<時間 >。It must be provided together with either \ or \. 如果\<日期 > 遺漏，其預設值是目前的日期。If \ is missing, its default value is the current day. 如果\<時間 > 遺漏，其預設值為 12:00: 00AM。If \ is missing, its default value is 12:00:00 AM. 如果\<日期 > 存在但其的年份元件只有兩位數，則會轉換成目前的文化特性的現行曆法的值中之年屬性。If \ is present but its year component consists of only two digits, it is converted to a year in the current culture's current calendar based on the value of the property. 如果\<位移 > 遺漏，其預設值都是當地時區位移。If \ is missing, its default value is the offset of the local time zone. \<位移 > 可以表示為負數或正數的位移與 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)。\ can represent either a negative or a positive offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 在任一情況下，\<位移 > 必須包含正負號。In either case, \ must include a sign symbol. `input`使用的格式設定資訊中剖析字串初始化目前的文化特性的物件。The `input` string is parsed by using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current culture. 若要剖析的字串包含指定的格式不一定會對應至目前的文化特性的格式，使用方法，並提供格式規範。To parse a string that contains designated formatting that does not necessarily correspond to the formatting of the current culture, use the method and provide a format specifier. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法來剖析日期和時間的數個字串。The following example calls the method to parse several date and time strings. 範例包括 en-us 文化特性的系統上的 2007 年 3 月 22 日，從輸出-我們。The example includes output from March 22, 2007, on a system whose culture is en-us. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會剖析所定義的格式必須是日期的字串表示`format`參數。The method parses the string representation of a date, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter. 它也需要\<日期 >，\<時間 >，並\<位移 > 日期和時間的字串表示的項目會出現在所指定的順序`format`。It also requires that the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time appear in the order specified by `format`. 如果`input`字串不符合這`format`參數，此方法會擲回。If the `input` string does not match this `format` parameter, the method throws a . 相反地，方法會剖析任何一種格式提供者所辨識的格式的日期的字串表示物件。In contrast, the method parses the string representation of a date in any one of the formats recognized by the format provider's object. 也可讓\<日期 >，\<時間 >，並\<位移 > 要按照任何順序出現的日期和時間的字串表示的項目。 also allows the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time to appear in any order. `format`參數是包含單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的格式字串`input`參數。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of the `input` parameter. 如需有效的格式化程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)並[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果`format`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果遺漏符號，方法會擲回。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . 如果`format`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果`format`要求`input`包含時間但不是日期，產生物件會指派給本機系統上目前的日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移，產生本機系統時區位移指派給物件。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the resulting object is assigned the time zone offset of the local system. 特定日期和時間的符號和中使用的字串`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數，因為是精確的格式`input`如果`format`是標準格式規範的字串。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter, as is the precise format of `input` if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 所傳回的物件及其屬性定義的符號和格式設定在`input`。The object returned by its property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. ## Examples 下列範例會使用具有標準和自訂格式規範和不變的文化特性剖析數的日期和時間字串的方法。The following example uses the method with standard and custom format specifiers and the invariant culture to parse several date and time strings. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會剖析的字元範圍表示中所定義的格式必須是日期`format`參數。This method parses a character span that represents a date, which must be in the format defined by the `format` parameter. 它也需要\<日期 >，\<時間 >，並\<位移 > 日期和時間的字串表示的項目會出現在所指定的順序`format`。It also requires that the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time appear in the order specified by `format`. 如果`input`se neshoduje`format`模式，方法會擲回。If `input` does not match the `format` pattern, the method throws a . 相反地，方法會剖析任何一種格式提供者所辨識的格式的日期的字串表示物件。In contrast, the method parses the string representation of a date in any one of the formats recognized by the format provider's object. 也可讓\<日期 >，\<時間 >，並\<位移 > 要按照任何順序出現的日期和時間的字串表示的項目。 also allows the \, \, and \ elements of the string representation of a date and time to appear in any order. `format`參數是包含單一字元的標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的格式的字元範圍`input`參數。The `format` parameter is a character span that contains either a single-character standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required format of the `input` parameter. 如需有效的格式化程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)並[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果`format`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果遺漏符號，方法會擲回。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . 如果`format`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果`format`要求`input`包含時間但不是日期，產生物件會指派給本機系統上目前的日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移，產生本機系統時區位移指派給物件。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the resulting object is assigned the time zone offset of the local system. 特定日期和時間的符號和中使用的字串`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數，因為是精確的格式`input`如果`format`是標準格式規範。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter, as is the precise format of `input` if `format` is a standard format specifier. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 所傳回的物件及其屬性定義的符號和格式設定在`input`。The object returned by its property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會剖析表示日期符合任何一個指派給模式的字元範圍`formats`參數。This method parses a character span representing a date that matches any one of the patterns assigned to the `formats` parameter. 如果`input`不符合任一這些模式的變化所定義的任何`styles`參數，此方法會擲回。If `input` does not match any one of these patterns with any of the variations defined by the `styles` parameter, the method throws a . 除了比較`input`到多個格式模式，這個多載的行為相同方法。Aside from comparing `input` to multiple formatting patterns, this overload behaves identically to the method. `formats`參數是字串陣列，其項目包含單一標準格式規範或定義的可能模式的一或多個自訂格式規範`input`參數。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements contain either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the possible pattern of the `input` parameter. 呼叫此方法時，`input`必須符合其中一種模式。When the method is called, `input` must match one of these patterns. 如需有效的格式化程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)並[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果中的相符項目`formats`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If the matched element in `formats` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果遺漏符號，方法會擲回。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用`formats`的這個多載來指定多個格式的參數可協助降低進入日期和時間時，許多使用者體驗的挫折。Using the `formats` parameter of this overload to specify multiple formats can help reduce the frustration many users experience when they enter dates and times. 特別是，能夠定義多個輸入的模式可讓應用程式來處理可以包含或缺少的幾個月、 天、 小時、 分鐘和秒的前置零的日期和時間表示。In particular, the ability to define multiple input patterns enables an application to handle date and time representations that can either include or lack leading zeros in months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds. 如果中的相符項目`formats`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果中的相符項目`formats`要求`input`包含時間但不是日期，產生物件會指派給本機系統上目前的日期。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果中的相符項目`formats`不需要`input`包含位移時，所產生的位移的值取決於物件`styles`參數。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果`styles`包含，當地時區位移指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果`styles`包含，Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 位移或 + 00:00，已指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果指定兩個值，則會使用當地時區位移。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. 特定日期和時間的符號和中使用的字串`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 也是如此的精確格式`input`，如果相符的項目的`formats`是標準格式規範的字串。The same is true for the precise format of `input`, if the matching element of `formats` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 所傳回的物件屬性定義的符號和格式設定在`input`。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles`參數可讓您定義是否允許泛空白字元在輸入字串中，指示如何剖析字串，而不需要明確的位移元件，並支援 UTC 轉換為剖析作業的一部分。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is permitted in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 所有成員列舉型別支援除了。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出支援的每個成員的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成員`DateTimeStyles` member|行為Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||剖析`input`而且，如果有需要，將它轉換成 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它相當於剖析的字串，然後呼叫方法傳回的物件。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果中的相符項目`formats`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件提供的當地時區位移。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 這是預設值。This is the default value.| ||如果中的相符項目`formats`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件指定 UTC 時差 （+ 00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的內部空白字元`format`。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by `format`. 額外的空白字元可以出現在日期和時間元件之間以及內個別元件 （除了位移），且剖析字串時，會忽略。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components (except the offset), and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的前置空格`formats`。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `formats`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含尾端空白不由指定`formats`。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by `formats`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`加入不由指定開頭、 結尾，和內部的空白`formats`。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `formats`. 未指定相符的項目中的所有額外泛空白字元`formats`時剖析字串都會被忽略。All extra white-space characters not specified in the matched element in `formats` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||表示中不允許其他泛空白字元`input`。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 空白字元必須出現在指定的完全相同的特定項目中`formats`進行比對。White space must appear exactly as specified in a particular element of `formats` for a match to occur. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||沒有任何作用，因為結構不包含`Kind`屬性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.|

Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果`format`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果遺漏符號，方法會擲回。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . 如果`format`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果`format`要求`input`包含時間但不是日期，產生物件會指派給本機系統上目前的日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移時，所產生的位移的值取決於物件`styles`參數。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果`styles`包含，當地時區位移指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果`styles`包含，Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 位移或 + 00:00，已指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果指定兩個值，則會使用當地時區位移。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. 特定日期和時間的符號和中使用的字串`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 也是如此的精確格式`input`，如果`format`是標準格式規範的字串。The same is true for the precise format of `input`, if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 所傳回的物件屬性定義的符號和格式設定在`input`。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles`參數可讓您定義是否允許泛空白字元在輸入字串中，指示如何剖析字串，而不需要明確的位移元件，並支援 UTC 轉換為剖析作業的一部分。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is allowed in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 所有成員列舉型別支援除了。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出支援的每個成員的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成員`DateTimeStyles` member|行為Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||剖析`input`而且，如果有需要，將它轉換成 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它相當於剖析的字串，然後呼叫方法傳回的物件。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件提供的當地時區位移。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 這是預設值。This is the default value.| ||如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件指定 UTC 時差 （+ 00:00）。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的內部空白字元`format`。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by `format`. 額外的空白字元可以出現日期和時間的元件之間，以及在個別的元件，和剖析字串時，會忽略。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components, and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的前置空格`format`。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `format`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含尾端空白不由指定`format`。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by `format`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`加入不由指定開頭、 結尾，和內部的空白`format`。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `format`. 中未指定的所有額外泛空白字元`format`時剖析字串都會被忽略。All extra white-space characters not specified in `format` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||表示中不允許其他泛空白字元`input`。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 泛空白字元必須出現在確實以指定`format`。White space must appear exactly as specified in `format`. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||沒有任何作用，因為結構不包含`Kind`屬性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.| ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法使用標準和自訂格式規範、 文化特性而異，和各種剖析數的日期和時間字串的值。The following example uses the method with standard and custom format specifiers, the invariant culture, and various values to parse several date and time strings. [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact/cs/ParseExact.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.ParseExact/vb/ParseExact.vb#2)] 下列範例會使用各種剖析預期要符合的字串陣列的值[ISO 8601](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier)。The following example uses a variety of values to parse an array of strings that are expected to conform to [ISO 8601](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier). 如範例輸出所示，正確格式的字串無法剖析如果：As the output from the example shows, strings that are in the proper format fail to parse if: - 它們包含泛空白字元和適當旗標 (例如方法呼叫中尚未提供。they contain white space, and an appropriate flag (such as has not been supplied in the method call. - 它們包含超出範圍的日期和時間的項目。they contain date and time elements that are out of range. 未指定 UTC 時差的字串會假設的當地時區位移 (在此情況下，-07:00) 除非旗標是方法呼叫中提供。Strings that do not specify a UTC offset are assumed to have the offset of the local time zone (in this case, -07:00) unless the flag is supplied in the method call. 在此情況下，它們會假設為國際標準時間。In that case, they are assumed to be Universal Coordinated Time. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法會剖析的日期字串表示符合任何一個模式指派給`formats`參數。The method parses the string representation of a date that matches any one of the patterns assigned to the `formats` parameter. 如果`input`字串不符合任一這些模式的變化所定義的任何`styles`參數，此方法會擲回。If the `input` string does not match any one of these patterns with any of the variations defined by the `styles` parameter, the method throws a . 除了比較`input`到多個格式模式，這個多載的行為相同方法。Aside from comparing `input` to multiple formatting patterns, this overload behaves identically to the method. `formats`參數是字串陣列，其項目包含單一標準格式規範或定義的可能模式的一或多個自訂格式規範`input`參數。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements contain either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the possible pattern of the `input` parameter. 呼叫此方法時，`input`必須符合其中一種模式。When the method is called, `input` must match one of these patterns. 如需有效的格式化程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)並[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果中的相符項目`formats`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If the matched element in `formats` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果遺漏符號，方法會擲回。If the sign is missing, the method throws a . > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用`formats`的這個多載來指定多個格式的參數可協助降低進入日期和時間時，許多使用者體驗的挫折。Using the `formats` parameter of this overload to specify multiple formats can help reduce the frustration many users experience when they enter dates and times. 特別是，能夠定義多個輸入的模式可讓應用程式來處理可以包含或缺少的幾個月、 天、 小時、 分鐘和秒的前置零的日期和時間表示。In particular, the ability to define multiple input patterns enables an application to handle date and time representations that can either include or lack leading zeros in months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds. 此圖說明範例。The example provides an illustration of this. 如果中的相符項目`formats`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果`styles`包含，當地時區位移指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果`styles`包含，Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 位移或 + 00:00，已指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果指定兩個值，則會使用當地時區位移。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. 特定日期和時間的符號和中使用的字串`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 也是如此的精確格式`input`，如果相符的項目的`formats`是標準格式規範的字串。The same is true for the precise format of `input`, if the matching element of `formats` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles`參數可讓您定義是否允許泛空白字元在輸入字串中，指示如何剖析字串，而不需要明確的位移元件，並支援 UTC matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的內部空白字元`format`。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by `format`. 額外的空白字元可以出現在日期和時間元件之間以及內個別元件 （除了位移），且剖析字串時，會忽略。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components (except the offset), and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的前置空格`formats`。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `formats`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the 結尾，和內部的空白`formats`。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `formats`. 未指定相符的項目中的所有額外泛空白字元`formats`時剖析字串都會被忽略。All extra white-space characters not specified in 空白字元必須出現在指定的完全相同的特定項目中`formats`進行比對。White space must appear exactly as specified in a particular element of `formats` for a match to occur. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||沒有任何作用，因為結構不包含`Kind`屬性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.| ## Examples 下列範例會定義多個輸入的日期與時間和位移的值的字串表示格式，並接著會傳遞由使用者輸入的字串方法。The following example defines multiple input formats for the string representation of a date and time and offset value, and then passes the string that is entered by the user to the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 的值不會影響屬性屬性。The property is not affected by the value of the property. 值屬性表示 0001 年 1 月 1 日，12:00:00 午夜起已經過的 100 奈秒間隔數 (值)。The value of the property represents the number of 100-nanosecond intervals that have elapsed since 12:00:00 midnight on January 1, 0001 (the value of ). 它不包含刻度將會新增閏秒。It does not include ticks that would be added by leap seconds. 奈秒是一個十億分之一秒;第二個有 10 萬個刻度。A nanosecond is one billionth of a second; there are ten million ticks in a second. 值屬性的範圍是從`DateTimeOffset.MinValue.Ticks`至`DateTimeOffset.MaxValue.Ticks`。The value of the property ranges from `DateTimeOffset.MinValue.Ticks` to `DateTimeOffset.MaxValue.Ticks`. 您可以指派至的刻度數物件使用建構函式多載。You can assign the number of ticks to a object by using the constructor overload. ## Examples 下列範例會初始化物件下的刻度數估計日期為 2008 年 7 月 1 日在 1:23:07。The following example initializes a object by approximating the number of ticks in the date July 1, 2008 1:23:07. 然後，它會顯示日期和主控台表示依該日期的刻度數。It then displays the date and the number of ticks represented by that date to the console. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在執行轉換為當地時間，方法首先將目前物件的日期和時間為 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 減去的時間位移。In performing the conversion to local time, the method first converts the current object's date and time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) by subtracting the offset from the time. 它然後將轉換的 UTC 日期和時間為當地時間加上當地時區位移。It then converts the UTC date and time to local time by adding the local time zone offset. 這麼做，需要針對當地時區調整規則的帳戶。In doing this, it takes account of any adjustment rules for the local time zone. 這兩個值的目前物件，而方法呼叫所傳回的物件代表相同的點的時間。Both the value of the current object and the value of the object returned by the method call represent the same point in time. 也就是說，如果兩者當中都會傳遞至方法，此方法會傳回`true`。That is, if both are passed to the method, the method will return `true`. 如果轉換會導致超出範圍的時間型別方法會傳回物件的日期和時間設定為 或和位移設定為本地時區位移。If the conversion causes a time that is out of range of the type, the method returns a object that has the date and time set to either or and the offset set to the local time zone offset. ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法，將轉換為太平洋標準時區的當地時間的值。The following example uses the method to convert a value to local time in the Pacific Standard Time zone. 它也會說明方法的當地時區的調整規則的支援。It also illustrates the method's support for the local time zone's adjustment rules. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法的傳回值為其相等的多載的相同方法，只不過它包含空格，後面附加在字串結尾的位移。The return value of this method is identical to that of its equivalent overload of the method, except that it includes a space followed by the offset appended at the end of the string. 換句話說，使用簡短日期模式，而長日期模式的輸出格式化和`zzz`自訂格式字串，從上一個項目，以空格分隔每個項目。In other words, it formats output using the short date pattern, the long time pattern, and the `zzz` custom format string, with each element separated from the previous element by a space. 這三個元素的格式由所定義`formatProvider`參數。The format of these three elements is defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A物件，表示文化特性的格式化慣例會套用至傳回的字串。A object that represents the culture whose formatting conventions are applied to the returned string. 所傳回的物件屬性會定義傳回之字串的格式。The object returned by the property defines the formatting of the returned string. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatProvider`已`null`，則會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件 (請參閱)。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object associated with the current culture is used (see ). ## Examples 下列範例會顯示物件使用代表文化特性而異，以及四個其他文化特性的物件。The following example displays a object using objects that represent the invariant culture, as well as four other cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`參數應該包含單一格式規範字元 (請參閱 < [ 標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)) 或自訂格式模式 (請參閱[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md))，定義傳回之字串的格式。The `format` parameter should contain either a single format specifier character (see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)) or a custom format pattern (see [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)) that defines the format of the returned string. 如果`format`是 null 或空字串 ("")，則值會使用預設格式來輸出。If `format` is a null or empty string (""), the value is output using the default format. 下表顯示特定的格式規範搭配使用時的確切的作業，這不同於其行為與搭配使用時。The following table shows the exact operation of certain format specifiers when used with , which differs from their behavior when used with . |現有的格式規範Existing format specifier|新的行為New behavior| |-------------------------------|------------------| |"K""K"|設計用於反覆存取日期和時間。Designed to round-trip a date and time. 使用，對應至"zzz"（位移一律會顯示以小時和分鐘）。With , maps to "zzz" (the offset is always displayed with hours and minutes). 請注意，"K"自訂格式規範;中的單一字元，它不能出現`format`。Note that "K" is a custom format specifier; it cannot appear as the single character in `format`.| |"U""U"|不支援。Not supported.| |"r""r"|將轉換物件為 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 並將其使用的自訂格式字串輸出`ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`。Converts the object to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and outputs it using the custom format string `ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`.| |"u""u"|將轉換物件為 UTC，並將輸出的格式`yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`。Converts the object to UTC and outputs it using the format `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`.| 其餘的標準日期和時間格式規範的行為相同，但方法與使用方法。The remaining standard date and time format specifiers behave the same with the method as they do with the method. 這個方法會使用衍生自目前的文化特性格式資訊。This method uses formatting information derived from the current culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱 。For more information, see . ## Examples 下列範例會顯示主控台使用每個標準日期和時間格式規範的物件。The following example displays a object to the console using each of the standard date and time format specifiers. 使用 en-us 會將輸出格式化為文化特性。The output is formatted by using the en-us culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks `format`參數應該包含單一格式規範字元 (請參閱 < [ 標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)) 或自訂格式模式 (請參閱[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)).The `format` parameter should contain either a single format specifier character (see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)) or a custom format pattern (see [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)). 如果`format`是 null 或空字串 ("")，則使用預設格式來輸出物件。If `format` is a null or empty string (""), the object is output using the default format. 下表顯示特定的格式規範搭配使用時的確切的作業，這不同於其行為與搭配使用時。The following table shows the exact operation of certain format specifiers when used with , which differs from their behavior when used with . |現有的格式規範Existing format specifier|新的行為New behavior| |-------------------------------|------------------| |"K""K"|設計用於反覆存取日期和時間。Designed to round-trip a date and time. 使用，對應至"zzz"（位移一律會顯示以小時和分鐘）。With , maps to "zzz" (the offset is always displayed with hours and minutes). 請注意，"K"自訂格式規範;中的單一字元，它不能出現`format`。Note that "K" is a custom format specifier; it cannot appear as the single character in `format`.| |"U""U"|不支援。Not supported.| |"r""r"|將轉換物件為 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 並將其使用的自訂格式字串輸出`ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`。Converts the object to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and outputs it using the custom format string `ddd, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss GMT`.| |"u""u"|將轉換值為 UTC，並將輸出的格式`yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`。Converts the value to UTC and outputs it using the format `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ssZ`.| 其餘的標準日期和時間格式規範的行為相同，但方法與使用方法。The remaining standard date and time format specifiers behave the same with the method as they do with the method. 對應至標準格式規範，以及符號與日期和時間元件的名稱的模式由定義`formatProvider`參數。The pattern that corresponds to standard format specifiers, as well as the symbols and names of date and time components, is defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A物件，表示其格式設定中使用的文化特性`input`。A object that represents the culture whose formatting is used in `input`. 所傳回的物件屬性會定義所使用的格式`input`。The object returned by the property defines the formatting used in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatProvider`已`null`，則會使用目前文化特性相關聯的物件 (請參閱)。If `formatProvider` is `null`, the object associated with the current culture is used (see ). ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法，以顯示物件使用的數個不同的文化特性的自訂格式字串。The following example uses the method to display a object using a custom format string for several different cultures. remarks.format: ## Remarks Unix 時間代表 1970年以來所經過的秒數-01-01T00:00:00Z (January 1，1970，在上午 12:00 UTC)。Unix time represents the number of seconds that have elapsed since 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z (January 1, 1970, at 12:00 AM UTC). 它不會考慮閏秒。It does not take leap seconds into account. 這個方法會傳回以 Unix 時間的毫秒數。This method returns the number of milliseconds in Unix time. 這個方法第一次會轉換成 UTC 的目前執行個體之前傳回它的 Unix 時間的毫秒數。This method first converts the current instance to UTC before returning the number of milliseconds in its Unix time. 變成 1970年以前的日期和時間值-01-01T00:00:00Z，這個方法會傳回負值。For date and time values before 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z, this method returns a negative value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。This overload of the method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 它會剖析具有三個項目可以按照任何順序出現，且以泛空白字元分隔的字串。It parses a string with three elements that can appear in any order and are delimited by white space. 下表中，會顯示這三個元素。These three elements are shown in the following table. |項目Element|範例Example| |-------------|-------------| |\<日期 >\|"2/10/2007""2/10/2007"| |\<時間 >\|「 下午 1:02:03""1:02:03 PM"| |\\|"-7:30""-7:30"| 這些項目都是選擇性的雖然\<位移 > 不能單獨出現。Although each of these elements is optional, \ cannot appear by itself. 它必須提供一起\<日期 > 或\<時間 >。It must be provided together with either \ or \. 如果\<日期 > 遺漏，其預設值是目前的日期。If \ is missing, its default value is the current day. 如果\<日期 > 存在但其的年份元件只有兩位數，則會轉換成目前的文化特性的現行曆法的值中之年屬性。If \ is present but its year component consists of only two digits, it is converted to a year in the current culture's current calendar based on the value of the property. 如果\<時間 > 遺漏，其預設值為 12:00: 00AM。If \ is missing, its default value is 12:00:00 AM. 如果\<位移 > 遺漏，其預設值都是當地時區位移。If \ is missing, its default value is the offset of the local time zone. 如果\<位移 > 已存在，它可以表示為負數或正數的位移與 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)。If \ is present, it can represent either a negative or a positive offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 在任一情況下，\<位移 > 必須包含正負號或這個方法會傳回`false`。In either case, \ must include a sign symbol or the method returns `false`. `input`使用的格式設定資訊中剖析字串初始化目前的文化特性的物件。The `input` string is parsed by using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current culture. 若要剖析的字串包含指定的格式不一定會對應於目前的文化特性，使用方法，並提供格式規範。To parse a string that contains designated formatting that does not necessarily correspond to that of the current culture, use the method and provide a format specifier. ## Examples 下列範例會呼叫方法來剖析數個與各種不同的日期和時間格式的字串。The following example calls the method to parse several strings with various date and time formats. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載方法就像方法，但是它不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。This overload of the method is like the method, except that it does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 方法會剖析具有三個項目可以按照任何順序出現，且以泛空白字元分隔的字串。The method parses a string with three elements that can appear in any order and are delimited by white space. 下表中，會顯示這三個元素。These three elements are shown in the following table. |項目Element|範例Example| |-------------|-------------| |\<日期 >\|"2/10/2007""2/10/2007"| |\<時間 >\|「 下午 1:02:03""1:02:03 PM"| |\\|"-7:30""-7:30"| 這些項目都是選擇性的雖然\<位移 > 不能單獨出現。Although each of these elements is optional, \ cannot appear by itself. 它必須提供一起\<日期 > 或\<時間 >。It must be provided together with either \ or \. 如果\<日期 > 遺漏，其預設值是目前的日期。If \ is missing, its default value is the current day. 如果\<日期 > 存在但其的年份元件只有兩位數，則會轉換成中之年`provider`的值為基礎的參數的現行曆法屬性。If \ is present but its year component consists of only two digits, it is converted to a year in the `provider` parameter's current calendar based on the value of the property. 如果\<時間 > 遺漏，其預設值為 12:00: 00AM。If \ is missing, its default value is 12:00:00 AM. 如果\<位移 > 遺漏，其預設值都是當地時區位移或如果或是中指定值`styles`。If \ is missing, its default value is the offset of the local time zone, or if either the or value is specified in `styles`. 如果\<位移 > 已存在，它可以表示為負數或正數的位移與 Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)。If \ is present, it can represent either a negative or a positive offset from Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). 在任一情況下，\<位移 > 必須包含正負號或這個方法會傳回`false`。In either case, \ must include a sign symbol or the method returns `false`. `input`字串會使用特定文化特性格式資訊，在剖析提供的物件`formatProvider`參數。The `input` string is parsed by using the culture-specific formatting information in a object supplied by the `formatProvider` parameter. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A物件，表示其格式設定中使用的文化特性`input`。A object that represents the culture whose formatting is used in `input`. 所傳回的物件屬性定義中使用的格式`input`。The object returned by the property defines the format that is used in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 此外，每個項目可以使用分隔前置或尾端泛空白字元，而\<日期 > 和\<時間 > 元件可以包含內部泛空白字元 (例如 6: 00:00).In addition, each element can be delimited by leading or trailing white space, and the \ and \ components can include inner white space (such as 6: 00:00). 只有\<位移 > 元件不能包含內部空白字元。Only the \ component cannot include inner white space. 如果`provider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `provider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. 正或負號用於\<位移 > 必須是 + 或-。The positive or negative sign used in \ must be either + or -. 不由定義或是的屬性所傳回的物件`formatprovider`參數的屬性。It is not defined by the or properties of the object returned by the `formatprovider` parameter's property. 下列成員支援列舉型別：The following members of the enumeration are supported: |DateTimeStyles 成員DateTimeStyles Member|註解Comments| |---------------------------|--------------| ||剖析字串，由`input`而且，如果有需要，將它轉換成 UTC。Parses the string represented by `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它相當於剖析的字串，並呼叫傳回的物件方法。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the returned object's method.| ||雖然有效，但會忽略此值。Although valid, this value is ignored. 在 允許內部空白字元\<日期 > 和\<時間 > 元件。Inner white space is allowed in the \ and \ components.| ||雖然有效，但會忽略此值。Although valid, this value is ignored. 剖析字串中的每個元件之前，可以使用前置空白字元。Leading white space is allowed in front of each component in the parsed string.| ||雖然有效，但會忽略此值。Although valid, this value is ignored. 剖析字串中的每個元件之前，允許使用尾端泛空白字元。Trailing white space is allowed in front of each component in the parsed string.| ||這是預設行為。This is the default behavior. 它不能覆寫透過提供更具限制性列舉值，例如。It cannot be overridden by supplying a more restrictive enumeration value, such as .| ||表示如果`input`參數缺少\<位移 > 項目，應提供的當地時區位移。Indicates that, if the `input` parameter lacks an \ element, the offset of the local time zone should be provided. 這是預設行為方法。This is the default behavior of the method.| ||表示如果`input`參數缺少\<位移 > 項目，應該提供 UTC 時差 (00:00)。Indicates that, if the `input` parameter lacks an \ element, the UTC offset (00:00) should be provided.| ||雖然有效，這個值會被忽略，而且沒有任何作用。Although valid, this value is ignored and has no effect.| ||因為結構不包含`Kind`屬性，這個值就沒有作用。Because the structure does not include a `Kind` property, this value has no effect.| 只有不支援的值。Only the value is not supported. 如果這個值會包含在會擲回`styles`參數。An is thrown if this value is included in the `styles` parameter. ## Examples remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載就像是方法，不同之處在於此方法不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。This overload is like the method, except that this method does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 它會剖析的日期和時間，必須完全符合指定模式的表示法`format`參數。It parses the representation of a date and time that must exactly match the pattern specified by the `format` parameter. 如果`input`不符合此模式中，使用一些可能的變化，在所定義的泛空白字元`styles`參數，剖析作業失敗，而且此方法會傳回`false`。If `input` does not match this pattern, with some possible variations in white space defined by the `styles` parameter, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. `format`參數是包含單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的模式的字元範圍`input`。The `format` parameter is a character span that contains either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required pattern of `input`. 如需有效的格式化程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)並[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果`format`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果正負號遺漏，剖析作業失敗，而且此方法會傳回`false`。If the sign is missing, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. 如果`format`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果`format`要求`input`包含時間但不是日期，產生物件會指派給本機系統上目前的日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移時，所產生的位移的值取決於物件`styles`參數。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果`styles`包含，當地時區位移指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果`styles`包含，Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 位移或 + 00:00，已指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果指定兩個值，則會使用當地時區位移。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. 特定日期和時間的符號和中使用的字串`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 也是如此的模式比對的精確`input`如果`format`是標準格式規範的字串。The same is true for the precise pattern of `input` if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 所傳回的物件屬性會定義符號，且標準的格式接受`input`。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and standard formats allowed in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles`參數可讓您定義是否允許泛空白字元在輸入字串中，指示如何剖析字串，而不需要明確的位移元件，並支援 UTC 轉換為剖析作業的一部分。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is allowed in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 所有成員列舉型別支援除了。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出支援的每個成員的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成員`DateTimeStyles` member|行為Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||剖析`input`而且，如果有需要，將它轉換成 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它相當於剖析日期和時間表示法，然後呼叫方法傳回的物件。It is equivalent to parsing a date and time representation, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件提供的當地時區位移。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件指定 UTC 時差 （+ 00:00）。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||可讓`input`包含內部的泛空白字元，未指定的格式。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by format. 額外的空白字元可以出現在日期和時間元件之間以及位移，以外的個別元件內且剖析字串時，會忽略。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components, other than the offset, and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的前置空格`format`。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `format`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含尾端空白不由指定`format`。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by `format`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`加入不由指定開頭、 結尾，和內部的空白`format`。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `format`. 中未指定的所有額外泛空白字元`format`時剖析字串都會被忽略。All extra white-space characters not specified in `format` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||表示中不允許其他泛空白字元`input`。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 泛空白字元必須出現在確實以指定`format`。White space must appear exactly as specified in `format`. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||沒有任何作用，因為結構不包含`Kind`屬性。Has no effect, because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法會剖析的日期字串表示符合任何一個模式指派給`formats`陣列。This method parses the string representation of a date that matches any one of the patterns assigned to the `formats` array. 如果`input`不符合任何一個這些模式所定義的任何變化`styles`參數，剖析作業失敗，而且此方法會傳回`false`。If `input` does not match any one of these patterns with any variations defined by the `styles` parameter, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. 除了比較`input`到多個字串，包含格式規範，這個多載的行為相同方法。Aside from comparing `input` to multiple strings that contain format specifiers, this overload behaves identically to the method. `formats`參數是字串陣列，其項目包含單一標準格式規範或定義的可能模式的一或多個自訂格式規範`input`。The `formats` parameter is a string array whose elements contain either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the possible pattern of `input`. 如需有效的格式化程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)並[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果中的相符項目`formats`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If the matched element in `formats` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果正負號遺漏，剖析作業失敗，而且此方法會傳回`false`。If the sign is missing, the parse operation fails and the method returns `false`. > [!IMPORTANT] > 使用`formats`的這個多載來指定多個格式的參數可協助降低進入日期和時間時，許多使用者體驗的挫折。Using the `formats` parameter of this overload to specify multiple formats can help reduce the frustration many users experience when they enter dates and times. 特別是，能夠定義多個輸入的模式可讓應用程式來處理可以包含或缺少的幾個月、 天、 小時、 分鐘和秒的前置零的日期和時間表示。In particular, the ability to define multiple input patterns enables an application to handle date and time representations that can either include or lack leading zeros in months, days, hours, minutes, and seconds. 此圖說明範例。The example provides an illustration of this. 如果中的相符項目`formats`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If the matched element in `formats` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果中的相符項目`formats`需要輸入包含時間但不是日期，產生物件會指派給本機系統上目前的日期。If the matched element in `formats` requires that input contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果中的相符項目`formats`不需要`input`包含位移時，所產生的位移的值取決於物件`styles`參數。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果`styles`包含，當地時區位移指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果`styles`包含，Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 位移或 + 00:00，已指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果指定兩個值，則會使用當地時區位移。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. 特定日期和時間中使用的符號`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數。The particular date and time symbols used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 也是如此的模式比對的精確`input`如果的相符的項目`formats`是標準格式規範的字串。The same is true for the precise pattern of `input` if the matching element of `formats` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 所傳回的物件屬性定義的符號和格式設定在`input`。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and formatting in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles`參數可讓您定義是否允許泛空白字元在輸入字串中，指示如何剖析字串，而不需要明確的位移元件，並支援 UTC 轉換為剖析作業的一部分。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is permitted in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 所有成員列舉型別支援除了。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出支援的每個成員的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成員`DateTimeStyles` member|行為Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||剖析`input`而且，如果有需要，將它轉換成 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它相當於剖析的字串，然後呼叫方法傳回的物件。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果中的相符項目`formats`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件提供的當地時區位移。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 這是預設值。This is the default value.| ||如果中的相符項目`formats`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件指定 UTC 時差 （+ 00:00）。If the matched element in `formats` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||可讓`input`包含未指定中的項目內部的泛空白字元`formats`。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by the elements in `formats`. 額外的空白字元可以出現日期和時間的元件之間，以及在個別的元件 （除了位移），並剖析字串時，會忽略。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components (except for the offset) and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含前置空格中的項目未指定`formats`。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含後端中的項目未指定的空格`formats`。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含前置、 尾端，與內部空間中的項目未指定`formats`。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by the elements in `formats`. 未指定相符的項目中的所有額外泛空白字元`formats`時剖析字串都會被忽略。All extra white-space characters not specified in the matched element in `formats` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||表示中不允許其他泛空白字元`input`。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 空白字元必須出現在完全中特定項目中所指定`formats`成功比對會發生。White space must appear exactly as specified in a particular element in `formats` for a successful match to occur. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||沒有任何作用，因為結構不包含`Kind`屬性。Has no effect because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.|

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載方法就像方法，不同之處在於此方法不會擲回例外狀況如果轉換失敗。This overload of the method is like the method, except that this method does not throw an exception if the conversion fails. 它會剖析的日期和時間，必須完全符合指定模式的字串表示`format`參數。It parses the string representation of a date and time that must exactly match the pattern specified by the `format` parameter. 如果`input`字串不符合此模式中，使用一些可能的變化，在所定義的泛空白字元`styles`參數，剖析作業失敗，而且此方法會傳回`false`。If the `input` string does not match this pattern, with some possible variations in white space defined by the `styles` parameter, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. `format`參數是字串，包含單一標準格式規範或一或多個自訂格式規範會定義所需的模式`input`。The `format` parameter is a string that contains either a single standard format specifier or one or more custom format specifiers that define the required pattern of `input`. 如需有效的格式化程式碼的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md)並[自訂日期和時間格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md)。For details about valid formatting codes, see [Standard Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md) and [Custom Date and Time Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-date-and-time-format-strings.md). 如果`format`包含`z`， `zz`，或`zzz`自訂格式規範，以指出位移必須存在於`input`，該時差必須包含負號或正號。If `format` includes the `z`, `zz`, or `zzz` custom format specifiers to indicate that an offset must be present in `input`, that offset must include either a negative sign or a positive sign. 如果正負號遺漏，剖析作業失敗，而且此方法會傳回`false`。If the sign is missing, the parsing operation fails and the method returns `false`. 如果`format`要求`input`包含日期而非時間，產生物件指派午夜的時間 (0: 00:00)。If `format` requires that `input` contain a date but not a time, the resulting object is assigned a time of midnight (0:00:00). 如果`format`要求`input`包含時間但不是日期，產生物件會指派給本機系統上目前的日期。If `format` requires that `input` contain a time but not a date, the resulting object is assigned the current date on the local system. 如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移時，所產生的位移的值取決於物件`styles`參數。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset, the offset of the resulting object depends on the value of the `styles` parameter. 如果`styles`包含，當地時區位移指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the offset of the local time zone is assigned to the object. 如果`styles`包含，Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) 位移或 + 00:00，已指派給物件。If `styles` includes , the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) offset, or +00:00, is assigned to the object. 如果指定兩個值，則會使用當地時區位移。If neither value is specified, the offset of the local time zone is used. 特定日期和時間的符號和中使用的字串`input`所定義`formatProvider`參數。The particular date and time symbols and strings used in `input` are defined by the `formatProvider` parameter. 也是如此的模式比對的精確`input`如果`format`是標準格式規範的字串。The same is true for the precise pattern of `input` if `format` is a standard format specifier string. `formatProvider`參數可以是下列其中一項：The `formatProvider` parameter can be either of the following: - A代表的文化特性的物件基礎所在`input`解譯。A object that represents the culture based on which `input` is interpreted. 所傳回的物件屬性會定義符號，且標準的格式接受`input`。The object returned by the property defines the symbols and standard formats allowed in `input`. - A定義格式的日期和時間資料的物件。A object that defines the format of date and time data. 如果`formatprovider`已`null`，則使用對應至目前的文化特性的物件。If `formatprovider` is `null`, the object that corresponds to the current culture is used. `styles`參數可讓您定義是否允許泛空白字元在輸入字串中，指示如何剖析字串，而不需要明確的位移元件，並支援 UTC 轉換為剖析作業的一部分。The `styles` parameter defines whether white space is allowed in the input string, indicates how strings without an explicit offset component are parsed, and supports UTC conversion as part of the parsing operation. 所有成員列舉型別支援除了。All members of the enumeration are supported except . 下表列出支援的每個成員的效果。The following table lists the effect of each supported member. |`DateTimeStyles` 成員`DateTimeStyles` member|行為Behavior| |-----------------------------|--------------| ||剖析`input`而且，如果有需要，將它轉換成 UTC。Parses `input` and, if necessary, converts it to UTC. 它相當於剖析的字串，然後呼叫方法傳回的物件。It is equivalent to parsing a string, and then calling the method of the returned object.| ||如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件提供的當地時區位移。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the offset of the local time zone. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||如果`format`不需要`input`包含位移的值，傳回的物件指定 UTC 時差 （+ 00:00）。If `format` does not require that `input` contain an offset value, the returned object is given the UTC offset (+00:00).| ||可讓`input`包含內部的泛空白字元，未指定的格式。Allows `input` to include inner white space not specified by format. 額外的空白字元可以出現在日期和時間元件之間以及位移，以外的個別元件內且剖析字串時，會忽略。Extra white space can appear between date and time components and within individual components, other than the offset, and is ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含未指定的前置空格`format`。Allows `input` to include leading spaces not specified by `format`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`包含尾端空白不由指定`format`。Allows `input` to include trailing spaces not specified by `format`. 剖析字串時，會忽略這些項目。These are ignored when parsing the string.| ||可讓`input`加入不由指定開頭、 結尾，和內部的空白`format`。Allows `input` to include leading, trailing, and inner spaces not specified by `format`. 中未指定的所有額外泛空白字元`format`時剖析字串都會被忽略。All extra white-space characters not specified in `format` are ignored when parsing the string.| ||表示中不允許其他泛空白字元`input`。Indicates that additional white space is not permitted in `input`. 泛空白字元必須出現在確實以指定`format`。White space must appear exactly as specified in `format`. 這是預設行為。This is the default behavior.| ||沒有任何作用，因為結構不包含`Kind`屬性。Has no effect, because the structure does not include a `Kind` property.| ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法使用標準和自訂格式規範、 文化特性而異，和各種剖析數的日期和時間字串的值。The following example uses the method with standard and custom format specifiers, the invariant culture, and various values to parse several date and time strings. [!code-csharp[System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact/cs/TryParseExact.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.DateTimeOffset.TryParseExact/vb/TryParseExact.vb#1)] 下列範例會使用各種剖析預期要符合的字串陣列的值[ISO 8601](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier)。The following example uses a variety of values to parse an array of strings that are expected to conform to [ISO 8601](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-date-and-time-format-strings.md#the-round-trip-o-o-format-specifier). 如範例輸出所示，正確格式的字串無法剖析如果：As the output from the example shows, strings that are in the proper format fail to parse if: - 它們包含泛空白字元和適當旗標 (例如方法呼叫中尚未提供。they contain white space, and an appropriate flag (such as has not been supplied in the method call. - 它們包含超出範圍的日期和時間的項目。they contain date and time elements that are out of range. 未指定 UTC 時差的字串會假設的當地時區位移 (在此情況下，-07:00，反映的太平洋日光節約時區位移) 除非旗標是方法呼叫中提供。Strings that do not specify a UTC offset are assumed to have the offset of the local time zone (in this case, -07:00, which reflects the offset of the Pacific Daylight Time zone) unless the flag is supplied in the method call. 在此情況下，它們會假設為國際標準時間。In that case, they are assumed to be Universal Coordinated Time. [!code-csharp[Parsing ISO 8601 strings](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system/datetimeoffset/tryparseexact/tryparseexacto8601-2.cs)] [!code-vb[Parsing ISO 8601 strings](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system/datetimeoffset/tryparseexact/tryparseexacto8601-2.vb)]
